body.section: How differs from a pure OpenStack cloud implementationThere are a number of enhancements in that are not available natively with a pure OpenStack implementation. The enhacements begin at installation time and take the cloud operator through integration, operations, and maintenance, and help secure your cloud on a number of fronts.

During installation of , for exampe, the core OpenStack services, such as compute, networking, orchestration, storage, and identity are installed automatically, and by default. These services are integrated and work together out of the box. Rather than configuring each service individually and configuring their interaction, the lifecycle manager, a collection of Ansible playbooks, script together those integrations. The playbooks read YAML files that describe your cloud confguration in human-readable text which you have entered or edited, and builds your coud based on those configuration settings.

lifecyle manager responsibilities go beyond installation and configuration, however. Ongoing management, in many instances can be achieved using the lifecycle manager rather than the OpenStack APIs as the Ansible playbooks themselves use the OpenStack APIs and abstract the tasks for you.

. In addition, the following security features are built into :
Data at rest encryption capabilities including encrypted storage of passwords and sensitive data
Reduction of surface vulnerabilities based on extensive years of experience running OpenStack in the HPE Public Cloud
Centralized Log Management capabilities, including a new integration with HPE ArcSight.
Security rules that allow only the ports that need to access the network installation to be opened.
AppArmor to provide an additional layer of automated protection against VM breakouts by proactively protecting the operating system and the applications from external or internal threats.
Role-based access control to control who and what can access services and
Auditing of inter-service activities
Arcsite
Barbican Key Management And finally the following management features are included.
Active health monitoring of the end to end cloud infrastructure
centralized logging all of the alerts and alarms for event correlation to root cause analysis
telemetry usage metering and internal usage reporting capabilities for showback/chargeback/and billing systems
Identity Management of AD and LDAP
